result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Jerome Beach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation by 3:00 p.m. March 2, 2015.
Probation to run concurrent.
Defendant is entitled to 90 days credit under 973.155.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be held open for 60 days.

Apply bond on file.
DNA surcharge.
Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation within 30 days if requested by Agent.

-Cooperate with any program as directed by Agent.
-Defendant to provide a DNA Sample.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-Restorative Justice Program if requested by Victim.
-Maintain full-time/part-time employment.
-Random UA's and PBT's.
-No Contact with K. McCarthy or L. Robl.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA within 30 days and follow all recommendations successfully.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Nicholas Jerome Beach appeared. Includes 14CF322, 14CF420, 14CF443. Case called at 3:20 pm. ADA Correll makes recommendations. No objection from Atty Harrelson.   Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds Def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for count one and two in 14CF322 and Count 3 in 14CF443, def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of Count 1 and Count 2 on 14CF322 and Guilty of Count 3 in 14CF443. Counts 1 and 2 in 14CF443 are dismissed but read in for purposes of restitution. 14CF420 is also dismissed and read in for purposes of restitution. Sentencing arguements. Court orders:
On Count 1 in 14CF322 - 3 years Probation W/H
- Court Costs
- Restition to be held open for 60 Days
- Jail 120 Days STAYED
- AODA and follow through
- Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation if requested by Agent
- Cooperate with any program as directed by Agent
- DNA Sample and surcharge on Count 1 in 14CF322
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to possess a firearm
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- Restortive Justice
- Maintain Employment
- Random UA's and PBT's
- No contact with K. Mccarthy or L. Robl
- Follow all rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
To sign up for probation by 3:00 pm on 3/2/2015
90 credit against ultimate sentence

Count 2 in 14CF322
2 years probation

On 14CF443, Count #3
2 years probation

Probation to run concurrent
  Probation review hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 04:45 pm.

SURETY NAME/S:It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Katie M. and Mr. Roble.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.
-   Contact with children needs to be through Human Services
-   Comply with supervision
 -  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Arraignment on October 21, 2014 at 10:15 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, K. McCarthy.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.
